items.sentence: I think that Tom didn\'t understand what he was supposed to do.
Tom can do the job, I\'m sure, but it\'ll take him a long time.
Tom can\'t trust Mary to look after his house while he\'s away.
Let\'s just make sure this is what we\'re supposed to be doing.
Tom paid for his lunch with the money his mother had given him.
Tom usually listens to a radio station that plays classic rock.
Tom was a little surprised by how well Mary could speak French.
It\'s a shame Tom had to work and couldn\'t go camping with us.
I don\'t know how I did it. What\'s important is that I did it.
Tom noticed that Mary wasn\'t wearing the ring he\'d given her.
Tom wondered how difficult it would be to find a job in Boston.
Tom wondered if Mary knew John had spent three years in prison.
Tom wondered if it was Mary who had sent him the box of apples.
Tom wondered where Mary was going to spend her summer vacation.
Tom wondered whether he should let Mary go to Boston with John.
Tom wouldn\'t have been able to manage without Mary\'s support.
Tom and Mary have been at odds with each other for a long time.
If you ever want to get better, you have to take this medicine.
Why did you do that without telling Tom what you were going to?
You have to understand that your parents are worried about you.
